# EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Copper plate mine at position(x=41.0, y=-82.0)
Consists of following entities
- Burner mining drill (position x=41.0, y=-82.0) and a stone furnace at position(x=41.0, y=-80.0)
- Burner mining drill (no other drill found) 

### Copper plate mine at position(x=60.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of following entities
- Stone furnace (position x=60.0, y=-60.0)

### Power generation structure at position(x=106.5, y=-32.5)
Consists of following entities
- Offshore pump (position x=106.5, y=-32.5)
- Boiler (position x=111.5, y=-32.0)
- Steam engine (position x=117.5, y=-30.5)
- Pipe group (position x=107.5, y=-34.5)
- Pipe group (position x=105.5, y=-32.5)

### Transport belt structure at position(x=40.5, y=-83.5)
Consists of following entities
- Belt group (position x=40.5, y=-83.5)
- Transport belt (position x=63.5, y=-53.5)
- Transport belt (position x=64.5, y=-53.5)

### Inserter structure at position(x=39.5, y=-79.5)
Consists of following entities
- Burner inserter (position x=39.5, y=-79.5)
- Burner inserter (position x=41.5, y=-78.5)

# ERROR TIPS
### Errors when using burner entities
- Ensure that the burner entities have fuel before using them.
- Examples: burner-mining-drill, burner-inserter

### Errors when using stone furnaces
- Ensure that the stone furnaces have ingredients before using them.

### Errors when using offshore pumps
- No errors found in the given logs.

### Errors when using boilers
- Ensure that the boilers have fuel before using them.

### Errors when using steam engines
- Ensure that the steam engines are connected before using them.

### Errors when using pipe groups
- Ensure that the pipe groups are not empty before using them.

### Errors when using electricity groups
- Ensure that the electricity groups are plugged into the electric network before using them.

### Errors when using belt groups
- Ensure that the belt groups are not empty before using them.

### Errors when using transport belts
- No errors found in the given logs.

# NAMESPACE
No utility functions or variables are defined in the given logs.
